channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024061019
item.description:
Report X-2024061019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT TRAM BY AND SAID THEY HAD A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS THAT THEY THOUGHT MAY BE LEAKING AS THERE WAS A STONG CHEMICAL SMELL COMING FROM THE PACKAG. RESPONDER OPENED UP THE PACKAGE AND FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND THE INSIDE CARDBOARD TO BE WET. FURTHER INSPECTION SHOWED 1 OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A VERY LOOSE CAP THAT HAD ALLOWED THE CONTENTS OF THE CONTAINER TO LEAK OUT.

item.title: Report X-2024061018
item.description:
Report X-2024061018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTICED WET CORNER ON THE PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED THE RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE PROCESSING AREA AND DISCOVERED THAT ONE INNER CONTAINER HAD A LOOSE CAP. BECAUSE THE CONTAINERS HAVE VENTED CAPS, THEY MAY NOT BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL ITEMS DISPOSED.

item.title: Report X-2024060876
item.description:
Report X-2024060876

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE UNLOADING A TRAILER, AN UNLOADER ENCOUNTERED A WET PACKAGE WITH HAZ MAT MARKINGS THAT ALSO SMELLED OF ALCOHOL. A RESPONDER WAS CALLED AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION, THE BOX WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN 4 BOTTLES OF ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL. ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP. THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED PER PROPER DMP PROCEDURES.
